Listing 7.6: Example of deﬁning an MLP model.
Important in the deﬁnition is the shape of the input; that is what the model expects as
input for each sample in terms of the number of time steps. The number of time steps as input
is the number we chose when preparing our dataset as an argument to the split sequence()
function. The input dimension for each sample is speciﬁed in the input dim argument on the
